elements.title: The Hooded Man (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Hooded Man (pictured) is an iconic photograph of the Iraq War, known as a symbol of torture at Abu Ghraib prison?

elements.title: Asiatyrannus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Asiatyrannus is thought to have grown to less than half the size of other tyrannosaurs?

elements.title: flag of Madagascar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the colours of the flag of Madagascar originally had no meaning?

elements.title: A. Sreekar Prasad holds a record for editing films (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indian film editor A. Sreekar Prasad holds a record for editing films in 17 different languages?

elements.title: Alfred Biliotti (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alfred Biliotti excavated the first known examples of Mycenaean painted pottery in 1868?

elements.title: Dublin Castle scandal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Dublin Castle scandal in 1884 led to the resignations, loss of positions, and criminal convictions of a number of British administrators in Dublin, and celebrations amongst Irish nationalists?

elements.title: Mannion v. Coors Brewing Co. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Mannion v. Coors Brewing Co., Judge Lewis A. Kaplan cited Thomas Mangelsen's Catch of the Day as a photograph so original in its timing that it could be copyrightable for that alone?

elements.title: the rulers of the Yuan dynasty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the rulers of the Yuan dynasty styled themselves as both Mongol khans and Chinese emperors?

elements.title: Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza is based on Egyptian Ratscrew?
